channel.title: UNIX on L. Collado-Torres
channel.description: Recent content in UNIX on L. Collado-Torres

item.title: me: Bad rm, don't delete stuff I didn't want to delete! (rm: well, I do what you tell me to do!)
item.description: When Sandy was in town at some point I started doing some of my research work, but I shouldn’t have. I basically did a silly mistake and erased files that take a long time to compute. Prior to being here, I had an alias in my bash profile like this: alias rm=’rm -i’ But when I setup my bash profile here I googled a bit to find what was the best common solution to avoid deleting stuff you shouldn’t be deleting.
